claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: A multi‐panel figure showing hemagglutination inhibition (HI) antibody titers (log₂ scale) at Day 0 and one month post‐vaccination against four influenza strains (A/H3N2, A/H1N1pdm09, B/Victoria, B/Yamagata) in two age cohorts (18–44 and 45–64 years), each vaccinated with various sequences of cell‐culture‐based quadrivalent inactivated vaccine (ccIIV4), recombinant HA vaccine (RIV4), and egg‐based IIV4. Box‐and‐whisker plots display individual and geometric mean titers with p‐values for pairwise comparisons. The figure presents comparative immunogenicity data (HI titers) for RIV4 (Flublok) versus other flu vaccines but does not report antigen content or explicitly link a threefold HA dose difference to the observed antibody responses, so it does not support the claim. Note: Assessment limited to the visible panels; antigen dose information is not shown and statistical comparisons are strain- and cohort-specific.
